page.title: 08THE CHURCH, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
St. Rufin's Church is the only place of worship in this area. Holy Communion is celebrated on the second Sunday in each month. The only other services being those in connection with Church Festivals.
The church is registered for Baptisms but not for Marriages or Funerals. There is no burial ground. The Rector is responsible for four village churches in Sandon, Hopton, Salt and Burston.
Its name is taken from the belief that Burston was the site of St. Chad's cell at the time of the conversion of the King of Mercia's sons Wulfad and Rufin to Christianity.
